predictions.text: NYMEX WTI crude oil (front-month) will settle at or above $95.00 per barrel on at least one trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if the official CME/NYMEX daily settlement price for the front-month WTI futures contract is >= 95.00 USD/bbl on any trading day on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: CME/NYMEX WTI settlement prices (CL)
ICE Brent settlement prices
DoD/USCENTCOM statements and verified reporting on U.S.-Iran escalation
Shipping/insurance disruption indicators in the Gulf (Lloyd’s, tanker rates)
predictions.rationale: Geopolitical risk premium around Iran can reprice quickly; a sharp spike is plausible but not the base case given current low price levels and OPEC+ spare capacity.

predictions.text: The U.S. Treasury (OFAC) will announce a new Iran-related sanctions action that designates at least 10 entities and/or vessels tied to Iran’s oil/petrochemical exports by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an OFAC press release or official SDN list update explicitly framed as Iran-related oil/petrochemical export enforcement includes >=10 new designations (entities and/or vessels) dated on or before 2026-03-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: OFAC press releases and SDN update logs
U.S. State Department Iran sanctions announcements
Treasury statements on enforcement against tanker/shipping networks
predictions.rationale: Sanctions are a common near-term escalation tool during negotiations and crisis signaling, often deployed in multi-designation packages against shipping and trading networks.

predictions.text: The European Commission will publish a press release/statement opening formal Digital Services Act (DSA) proceedings against TikTok that explicitly references addictive design or recommender-system risks by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if the European Commission announces the opening of formal DSA proceedings against TikTok (by name) and the announcement text explicitly cites addictive design, infinite scroll, or recommender-system/addiction-type risks, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: European Commission DSA enforcement press releases
DSA transparency database / Commission announcements
Statements from the Irish DPC or other EU digital regulators on TikTok
predictions.rationale: The reported EU intervention increases the odds of escalation to formal Commission proceedings under the DSA as enforcement focus shifts from content to product design.

predictions.text: TikTok will publicly confirm product changes in the EU that disable or materially limit infinite scroll and/or substantially alter its recommendation feed mechanics to address EU concerns by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if TikTok publishes an official EU-facing announcement (blog post, newsroom item, or official statement to a regulator) confirming rollout of EU-specific changes that (a) disable/limit infinite scroll and/or (b) materially change recommendation feed mechanics, dated by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: TikTok Newsroom / policy blog posts referencing EU changes
EU regulator compliance updates and enforcement notices
App version release notes and EU-specific feature flags reported by researchers
predictions.rationale: Once regulators order design changes, platforms typically implement and publicize compliance steps within months to reduce litigation/enforcement risk.

predictions.text: Microsoft will report property and equipment additions (capex) of at least $25.0 billion in at least one fiscal quarter with an end date on or before 2026-06-30, as shown in its quarterly financial statements filed by 2026-08-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if Microsoft’s 10-Q/10-K for any quarter ended on/before 2026-06-30 reports ‘Additions to property and equipment’ (or equivalent capex line in cash flow) >= 25.0B USD for that quarter, filed by 2026-08-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Microsoft 10-Q filings and cash-flow capex line items
Earnings call commentary on data-center buildout pace
Data-center leasing/cancellation reports and supplier order trends
predictions.rationale: AI infrastructure spending is elevated; hitting a very high single-quarter capex print is plausible but depends on timing of build and payments.

predictions.text: Norway’s national cyber authority (e.g., NSM/NCSC) will publish a public advisory or report that explicitly names “Salt Typhoon” as a threat actor/campaign by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an official Norwegian government cyber-security body publishes an advisory/report that includes the exact term “Salt Typhoon” and describes it as an intrusion set/campaign, dated by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: NSM/NCSC public advisories and annual/quarterly threat reports
CERT notices and joint advisories with allies
Statements attributing intrusions to China-linked actors
predictions.rationale: If the campaign affected Norwegian firms, public attribution and guidance often follow, especially when allied governments standardize actor naming.

predictions.text: The UN Security Council will adopt a resolution expanding or renewing an international security mandate for Haiti that explicitly authorizes additional personnel or expanded rules of engagement by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if the UNSC adopts (vote recorded) a Haiti-related resolution whose text explicitly expands or renews a security mandate and includes authorization for either (a) additional personnel levels, or (b) expanded enforcement authorities/rules of engagement, by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: UNSC meeting calendar and draft resolution circulation
UN press releases and Security Council voting records
Public statements by U.S., Canada, and CARICOM on Haiti security
predictions.rationale: Deteriorating security and governance vacuum increase pressure for UN-backed escalation, but consensus and resourcing constraints keep odds below even.

predictions.text: The Gateway Development Commission (or USDOT/FRA) will announce execution of a Full Funding Grant Agreement (FFGA) or equivalent federal full-funding commitment for the Hudson Tunnel Project by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an official press release or posted agreement announces that an FFGA (or explicitly named equivalent full-funding commitment) for the Hudson Tunnel Project has been executed, dated by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: Gateway Development Commission announcements
FRA Capital Investment Grants program notices
Federal Register / USDOT grant documentation updates
predictions.rationale: With near-term funding risk reduced by the court ruling, the project is positioned to move toward a formal full-funding agreement, though federal budget politics remain a risk.

predictions.text: The U.S. (USTR or Department of Commerce) will announce a new trade restriction specifically targeting Chinese EVs and/or battery materials that includes at least one new or increased tariff rate stated numerically, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Verified if an official USTR/Commerce announcement (press release, Federal Register notice, or fact sheet) introduces a new or increased tariff on Chinese EVs and/or battery materials and states at least one tariff rate numerically, dated by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
monitoring_signals: USTR press releases and Federal Register tariff actions
Commerce investigations (AD/CVD) related to EV/battery supply chains
U.S. auto/battery industry lobbying and trade-case filings
predictions.rationale: EV supply-chain and China industrial-policy concerns make additional targeted restrictions plausible, but timing depends on investigations and domestic political bandwidth.
